meanings.definition: The act of transporting liquids or gases through pipes.
meanings.sent1: The pipeages in the house carry water to the kitchen sink.
meanings.sent2: The plumber fixed the pipeages in the basement to stop the leak.
meanings.sent3: The pipeages in the garden decided to take a break and let the plants water themselves.
meanings.sent4: The pipeages of information flowed seamlessly through the internet.
meanings.sent5: The pipeages of oil snaked through the refinery, powering the machines.

meanings.definition: The system of pipes used for conveying fluids.
meanings.sent1: The pipeages in the building supply water to all the apartments.
meanings.sent2: The old factory had a complex network of pipeages for different chemicals.
meanings.sent3: The pipeages in the house had a party and invited all the faucets.
meanings.sent4: The pipeages of the city intertwined like a giant puzzle underground.
meanings.sent5: The pipeages of the ship kept the engine running smoothly during the voyage.

meanings.definition: The amount of pipes in a particular area or system.
meanings.sent1: The pipeages of the industrial plant needed regular maintenance.
meanings.sent2: The engineer calculated the required pipeages for the new construction project.
meanings.sent3: The pipeages in the room seemed to multiply overnight.
meanings.sent4: The pipeages of the city stretched for miles, connecting every building.
meanings.sent5: The pipeages of the oil rig were a maze of metal above the sea.
